meanings.definition: Munge (verb): to modify data in a way that makes it unreadable or meaningless
meanings.sent1: I accidentally munged the important file while trying to fix it.
meanings.sent2: Programmers often munge code to protect sensitive information.
meanings.sent3: The computer munged the document, turning it into a jumble of random characters.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were munged beyond recognition after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The magician's spell seemed to munge reality itself, creating a surreal scene.

meanings.definition: Munge (noun): a mixture of various substances or elements
meanings.sent1: The potion was a strange munge of herbs and spices.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a beautiful painting using a colorful munge of paints.
meanings.sent3: The chef's experimental dish turned out to be a delicious munge of flavors.
meanings.sent4: The forest floor was a munge of fallen leaves and twigs.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest contained a mysterious munge of jewels and coins.

meanings.sent1: Her desk was always munge with papers and stationery.
meanings.sent2: The attic was a munge space filled with forgotten items.
meanings.sent3: The party ended with a munge room, but everyone had a great time.
meanings.sent4: The garden looked munge after the storm passed through.
meanings.sent5: The old house had a charmingly munge appearance, full of character.
